title: Am I the only one who's glad Ashe is a top tier ADC?
body:
She's really one of the more tolerable ADCs. She's strong, but she has really clear weaknesses you can exploit. It's a nice change given that the top tier ADCs for the past few seasons have usually been highly mobile swiss army knives with high burst on top of their DPS like Lucian/Graves/Corki.

Sure, there are some annoying things about her kit, but that's true of literally every champion. I know I definitely prefer when the best champions for a glass-cannon DPS role aren't also bursty as fuck and actually die when jumped on. Those champions have a place, but IMO they shouldn't be the best in their role.

EDIT: To be clear, I'm not saying she's not a pain to play against or that she doesn't need nerfs, I'm saying that I'd rather deal with Ashe's particular brand of bullshit than the nonsense we've had to deal with for the majority of the last few seasons.

replies.body: It's always obvious when someone that doesn't play ADC is talking about ADC.
Your comment, like your name.
***MOM GET THE CAMERA***
Okay!
LMFAO

> [{quoted}](name=disregardable,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pr6JJ1eb,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-08-30T19:58:06.205+0000)
>
> It's always obvious when someone that doesn't play ADC is talking about ADC.

Yeah I play champions designed to kill ADCs and I like it when that's actually possible.
{{champion:222}} Assassinating Assassins since 2013

> [{quoted}](name=TequilaZombie,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pr6JJ1eb,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-31T00:59:34.612+0000)
>
> {{champion:222}} Assassinating Assassins since 2013

wait what? jinx is one of the most vulnerable adcs. sure shes strong right now and her range is giniormous, but i mean...if you get on top of her she is literally fucked with no answer besides flash.
Clearly has not played against an akali lol

The thing with Ashe is that she's supposed to be a utility carry, not a high DPS carry.  When the ADC with the most utility at the position is also putting out the most damage in team fights consistently, that's the issue.  I'm all for Ashe being strong if it's for one of those elements, not both.

this guy actually gets it. sivir had the same problem but feels more in line after those nerfs.

a champ who is strong in utility relative to their class should never be near the top in dps. middle of the road maybe, but top tier dps and utility means they become pick or ban. 

Jhin, Sivir, Ashe all have utility and have insane damage. Jhin might be the only one with bad sustained damage but his burst damage more than makes up for it. 

in theory the highest dps adcs should be Kog Maw, Twitch, Corki, Miss Fortune, Draven, Lucian, Jinx because they offer nothing but pure damage to their teams. corki has a passive once every 5 minutes and jinx has traps but i digress. (jinx traps are very long cd and cait has full zone of control with 5 traps)
She trades mobility for utility basically. Champions who have neither such as jinx kog or twitch have better dmg output.
Twitch not so much due to his invisibility. They kinda nipped his damage compensation a bit compared to what he used to be able to get as a result.
I think the less mobility they have the more DPS they do, too. {{champion:96}} is a great example. {{champion:236}} or {{champion:42}} I'm iffy about.

Theres a problem with that, she also lacks mobility. Sure, shes supposed to be a utility carry, but her utility is compensation for her mobility moreso than damage. Jinx and kog are given more damage in compensation compared to ashe, for example.
She doesn't feel as overbearing to deal with as other ADC's when strong. I'll take her over Vayne, Kalista, or Ezreal metas
That beatiful moment when you catch a splitpushing Jinx with no allies nearby, jumps on her as an assassin and have your ass handed to you as SHE assassinates YOU.
I don't really get how that can happen to Fizz, zed, and talon. She is still a adc without escapes unless she kills a building or your ally

As long as you have some kind of delay in your combo, she can pretty much out damage and out heal you 9/10 times if she has 100% health.

Fizz, Zed and Talon are all more or less instant bursts. I'm afraid of the monsters some adcs will turn into after the assassin update.
Kha'zix can also delete her when she is isolated. His R means "You ain't fucking touchin' me while I get my cds back bitch"

But, right now, she has insane damage and her arrow, which most other ADCs can't keep up with. With Ashe and Jhin as the top tier, if you see one, you're forced to pick the other just so you can keep up in damage. If one is banned and one is picked, bot lane is almost guaranteed to lose. Yes, they die when jumped on, but they have enough poke to make sure that you can't jump on them. And them just existing with the amount of damage that they have right now makes literally every other ADC unviable when compared to them. Honestly, I'm glad that they got nerfs this patch. Not sure if it'll be enough because I haven't seen either of them yet, though.

Let's look at Twitch as an example. He's strong and has decent burst in his kit with his E, but Ashe and Jhin have so much range on him that they just destroy him. For Ashe, it's a skill matchup between both players in bot lane. If your bot laners are just outright better at their picks than the enemy bot laners, they can win. However, the instant Ashe hits 6, if Twitch hasn't killed her several times by that point, she just fires an arrow into his face and kills him. And then does it again. And then again. Every single ADC in the game, when playing against an Ashe, has to crush her into the dust to the point where she's useless other than the arrow in order to not just have the lane turn into her favor the instant she hits 6, and even then they still have to play 100% perfectly to avoid throwing. The arrow moves fast enough that you can't dodge it from a short distance without instant mobility, so unless you're playing Sivir, Nocturne, have your flash up, or have a QSS, no matter how far ahead you are, Ashe can just ult you and kill you. Even point-blank, it's a 1.5 second stun. If she has her Q stacked up beforehand, you'll be lucky to survive that if you aren't a tank.

And, she's the only ADC I can think of off the top of my head that has a stun or something else that prevents you from moving and attacking entirely. And don't say Urgot because he's so off-meta and obscure that nobody will be playing him in ranked, plus he also immobilizes and stops himself from attacking during the duration.

> [{quoted}](name=Brutalitops01,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pr6JJ1eb,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-08-30T20:16:25.442+0000)
>
> But, right now, she has insane damage and her arrow, which most other ADCs can't keep up with. With Ashe and Jhin as the top tier, if you see one, you're forced to pick the other just so you can keep up in damage. If one is banned and one is picked, bot lane is almost guaranteed to lose. Yes, they die when jumped on, but they have enough poke to make sure that you can't jump on them. And them just existing with the amount of damage that they have right now makes literally every other ADC unviable when compared to them. Honestly, I'm glad that they got nerfs this patch. Not sure if it'll be enough because I haven't seen either of them yet, though.
> 
> Let's look at Twitch as an example. He's strong and has decent burst in his kit with his E, but Ashe and Jhin have so much range on him that they just destroy him. For Ashe, it's a skill matchup between both players in bot lane. If your bot laners are just outright better at their picks than the enemy bot laners, they can win. However, the instant Ashe hits 6, if Twitch hasn't killed her several times by that point, she just fires an arrow into his face and kills him. And then does it again. And then again. Every single ADC in the game, when playing against an Ashe, has to crush her into the dust to the point where she's useless other than the arrow in order to not just have the lane turn into her favor the instant she hits 6, and even then they still have to play 100% perfectly to avoid throwing. The arrow moves fast enough that you can't dodge it from a short distance without instant mobility, so unless you're playing Sivir, Nocturne, have your flash up, or have a QSS, no matter how far ahead you are, Ashe can just ult you and kill you. Even point-blank, it's a 1.5 second stun. If she has her Q stacked up beforehand, you'll be lucky to survive that if you aren't a tank.
> 
> And, she's the only ADC I can think of off the top of my head that has a stun or something else that prevents you from moving and attacking entirely. And don't say Urgot because he's so off-meta and obscure that nobody will be playing him in ranked, plus he also immobilizes and stops himself from attacking during the duration.

I'm not saying she isn't overpowered, but there's always going to be an overpowered ADC and I would rather it be ashe than most of the champions we've had to deal with for the past year or two.

It'd be nice if we could see buffs to other actual DPS carries so that we get them in the meta when ashe gets nerfed instead of going back to Lucian/Corki/Graves bullshit. I like it when the enemy ADC doesn't burst me as fast as I burst them when I'm playing a burst champion.

Twitch is my main, and I'd be pretty happy to see him become meta again. He has burst, but he has to build attack speed to make that burst fast, and even then it can't compete with a true assassin's. He is a strong champion, and it's fun to use his stealth to catch an enemy off-guard (when they don't just turn around and kill you with an arrow to the face/stronger burst). Twitch, Kog'Maw, and Jinx I'd say are the 3 most ADCs who are the least annoying to deal with, while simultaneously being strong enough to carry games.

Jinx is cancer to play against what are you talking about? She has long-range AoE crits, a nuke with a crippling slow on top, an AoE root that blocks off your path to escape, and a massive AoE execute on top of that. Not to mention lategame it takes like 2-3 people to even hope to kill her because she attacks ridiculously fast and Bloodthirster makes her impossible to deal with. If she gets even the tiniest bit ahead she blows you up from massive range with CC that would make a utility mage cry.

Jinx isn't too bad, maybe im biased since she is my best adc but,
 Zap isn't much of a nuke but if you get hit with any stun/slow late game you will probably die.
The aoe crits only hurt late game and maybe late mid.
The root only blocks your escape if she is closer/as close to it as you.
The execute is a skill-shot.
Late game she beats most ADCs in a 1v1 but maybe kog and vayne(other hyper carries). Any assassin,tank,fighter should beat her if she is alone. The attack speed takes 3 autos to rev up.
I don't get the "blows you up from massive range with cc...utility mage cry" Her zap will do about 15-20% your health if your squishy,  less if you are tanky and is a skillshot. 

Jinx is in quite a good spot right now and is manageable as long as your whole team isn't really behind.

AoE root and a 2 second 70% slow with 1500 range? Good luck getting away from that on top of her 275% damage rocket crits from 700 range. Why they buffed her massive execute nuke is beyond me.

You can't just give me half a page worth of her pros and say it's 'manageable'. 'Jinx isn't too bad since she is my best ADC' of course you're blatantly biased I'd be the same way defending TK. Jinx is a cancer lane because she's a huge lane bully with insane kill pressure that ramps up into one of the hugest, most unmanageable hypercarries in the game.
I'd Take Jinx anyday of the week over Vayne. Its champs like vayne i never want to see viable under any circumstance.

And don't say Urgot because he's so off-meta and obscure that nobody will be playing him in ranked, plus he also immobilizes and stops himself from attacking during the duration.

Yep, this is the problem.

Jhin also does a fuck ton of damage and can bully ashe early, pre 6. But if she's even if she hits an arrow even jhin is probably fucked.
Yeah I much prefer when the ADC who has the best utility also has top tier damage, it's way better than when the best ADC pretty much just brings damage.
Am I the only one who wishes that there wasn't a top tier adc and all adcs were equal strength, with meaningful tradeoffs, weaknesses, and advantages, and counters.
I also like to live in fantasy land.
Some games are able to balance all their heroes, its not my fault League made an endless circle of nerfing and buffing.

> [{quoted}](name=Zedex,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=pr6JJ1eb,comment-id=001100010000,timestamp=2016-08-31T01:56:30.266+0000)
>
> Some games are able to balance all their heroes, its not my fault League made an endless circle of nerfing and buffing.

None of them are. The only one that's close is dota and that's because their entire game is built around hard counters so more things are going to be playable, but hard counter gameplay is fucking terrible from a play perspective.

As someone who plays DotA2: Feels fine to me from a play perspective. There's a reason it's a team game. If you're a Riki and they pick Bristleback, it's an uphill battle, but you still have 4 other people to beat the hell out of - it's not just Bristle standing there on Final Destination saying '1v1 me, bro!'

Yeah, but that's basically impossible.  Even if they were individually equal in strength, there are too many other factors that can shift the balance.

Even if a proper balance was found, it would likely result in the game becoming stale extremely quickly.

I am a big fan of mostly immobile adc such as jinx, ashe jhin kog being top tier. When the highly mobile ones are meta it makes it difficult to play assassins or bruisers. Oh I am a teundle and I forced my way through your frontline to get to you? Nope you just dash or blink over a nearby wall. Feels good man.

I remember when Jhin was released and people were like "xd jhin is shit he wont b played in lcs or high elo ever xd"

Now people are saying he's op. feelsbadman

I think riot is nerfing her specifically for worlds, but I think that's a little odd in that her arrow is an #LCSbigplay starter.  

I'm looking at her stats right now and she seems below average in just about every area yet she still has a decent win rate.  For instance she has one of the lowest damage amounts in plat+ games so she's not the damage monster people think she is.  She doesn't get that many kills.  Her CS is average.  

I'm thinking it's her ult that's keeping her afloat.

nope
i would actually like to have a choice late game, but with ashe its only one. death.
any other adc i actually have a half assed chance to get out
depends on the champ your playing tbh, Riven and fiora can just delete her on most occasions.
flash? leaps? dashes? ghost to nullify the slow?
My favorite thing I like about it is that she's a 450 champion, so I don't have to drop 6300 on a champ which looks fun to play and is strong right now.
True, it's much nicer than last season when we had Jinx every game. The adc meta around worlds last year was disgustingly imbalanced.

I like that she's one of the trinity at the moment. Like the OP already mentioned, Ashe has exploitable weaknesses even while strong. Assassins can jump her, she can be chased down (especially by Olaf), and the usual adc counters of building armor items still dampens her damage. The only thing that needs to be tuned at the moment is her Q.

considering she was in the gutter from the games inception till now (teleport+ult ganks dont count)

it doesn't bother me either
{{champion:96}} daddy coming

I have to disagree.

Ashe has too much damage for her CC.

Just like those with mobility need to sacrifice something, Ashe should need to sacrifice damage for her CC.

She should NOT be capable of straight outdamaging a Jinx/Caitlyn/Tristana/Twitch/Miss Fortune/etc... who bring neither reliable CC nor oodles of mobility. Yet with her Q and W, she can handle any of them pretty consistently. Ashe should need to use her slows to escape all-ins in the laning phase (or help a secure a gank) but instead she's able to use them to secure all-ins in laning phase.

Half of the ADC roster is healthy as the "best" in the role. Ashe is not in that half. Neither are Lucian/Ezreal/Corki/Sivir (what we've seen lately) but just because we've previously had one type of "wrong" doesn't mean the current is any better (and as a Jinx player that dreaded going against Ashe since I started playing in season 4, I have to say it's worse).

>Just like those with mobility need to sacrifice something.

I'm just going to point this out, in general ADCs with mobility sacrifice utility and ADCs with utility sacrifice mobility. There are some exceptions to this, for example Sivir sacrifices range so she can get a bit of both and Kog sacrifices both so he can double down on damage and range but for about 70% of ADCs this is the tradeoff.

An ADC definitively can't tradeoff damage. One of the core defining traits of ADCs is that they output strong sustained damage through auto attacks. When ADCs can't do this they need an extreme in another form of damage in order to offset this weakness, for example Ezreal's poke damage. 

When ADCs don't bring any form of applicable damage, as in the case of Ashe prerework and current Kalista (thank fucking god) they are not actually playable, at least in botlane.

Yes, i really like that Ashe is a top-tier ADC atm.

{{champion:107}}

I really don't understand why Riot decided that "Ashe is a utility marksman and shouldn't be stronger than other ADCs" when really we have Lucian running around with Black Cleaver being an OP utility marksman himself. A really quickly armor shredder is a pretty meaningful tool for a teamfight.

They should just stop touching Ashe to be honest. She has no tools that can assure her an escape and she can really quickly get gutted by any assassin. They also nerfed Sivir of all champions. Why? She's barely even played anymore. She had a few two patches where she was a god tier ADC because of her W crits, but now most people know how to even counter THAT.

They don't do some champions their justice and solely because of the LCS. Solely because "Ashe enables easy kills" and "Sivir is a speedbuffer". Riot gives these ADCs SO much meaning when really they're not half as meaningful outside of the LCS.
